Articles.Content:
Hi here.

I'm using the latest version of ckan and I'm on ksp version 1.8.1 to install some mods one of them being USI. I have unfortunately ran into an issue where the game has gotten stuck loading a specific part. The game does not crash, or indicate any issues, it just gets stuck loading the same thing.

The filepath in question is: UmbraSpaceIndustries/MKS/Parts/Tundra_PDU/Tundra_PDU

Thanks.
Welcome to the forum @Wizzalien, your issue has been moved to tech support, modded.

There might be errors or exceptions in the log files. The easiest to find but least detailed is called KSP.txt and is located directly inside the KSP directory, so if you’re on CKAN click ‘File’ then ‘Open KSP directory’ to take you straight there.

More detailed logs can be found in the files called Player.txt and/or output_log.txt, these can be found under C:/users/your username/AppData/LocalLow/Squad/Kerbal Space Programif you’re on windows 10; if pasting that link into file explorer doesn’t work then try searching for the file names themselves; AppDada is a hidden folder so may not be visible if you try to navigate through the folders to find it manually.

 

You could also try deleting that particular file to remove the problem but if one thing is failing then it’s possible that there are other issues behind the scenes.

7 hours ago, jimmymcgoochie said:

There might be errors or exceptions in the log files. The easiest to find but least detailed is called KSP.txt and is located directly inside the KSP directory, so if you’re on CKAN click ‘File’ then ‘Open KSP directory’ to take you straight there.

More detailed logs can be found in the files called Player.txt and/or output_log.txt, these can be found under C:/users/your username/AppData/LocalLow/Squad/Kerbal Space Programif you’re on windows 10; if pasting that link into file explorer doesn’t work then try searching for the file names themselves; AppDada is a hidden folder so may not be visible if you try to navigate through the folders to find it manually.

 

You could also try deleting that particular file to remove the problem but if one thing is failing then it’s possible that there are other issues behind the scenes.

Yeah I deleted the part and the game loads fine, however I'm getting a strange issue with vessle viewer. I have raster prop monitor and all its dependancies installed, however clicking vessle veiwer on the panel causes it to the panel to become non functional. I'll be on the look out for more weird things.
